samples.question: And how important are they for the local or national economy?
samples.transcript: Well, actually, firstly, it generates a great number of job opportunities for localities. Also, it pushes the GDP or the overall economy of the locals or the whole country up. And well, it, somehow creates a habit of buying domestic products for residents.
samples.transcript_original: Well, actually, firstly, it generates a great number of job opportunities for localities. Also, it pushes the GDP or the overall economy of the locals or the whole country up. And well, it, um, somehow creates a habit of buying domestic products for residents.

samples.question: Why is that?
samples.transcript: Well, it is said in one of my economic subjects that the economy will only go up when there is manufacture or there is production in the country. So, well, because the economy is measured itself by the production, it is clearly better to produce more in the country. Yeah, alright. Not importing. Okay.

samples.question: So is manufacturing more important in your home country now than it was in the past?

And well, I think it is can be attributed to commercials when they could not stop advertising their products as the newest or the most innovative. So that on the spur of the moment, customers will desire to own that product. And that leads to excessive consuming. Yeah, you make it sound like a mental disorder.

samples.question: Do you like music?
samples.transcript: Absolutely. I am actually a fan of music. My favorite song is FKJ. I really love listening to FKJ music because it helps me to ease my mind after I work hard long day. Yeah.
samples.transcript_original: Absolutely. I'm actually a fan of music. My favorite song is FKJ. I really love listening to FKJ music because it helps me to ease my mind after I work hard long day. Yeah.

samples.question: So what is your favorite type of music and why?
samples.transcript: I do not have too much knowledge on this but I would say something soft. Indian music actually. And FKJ is actually a very well-known songwriter and like song maker of this type music as well. And I find listening to his music very relaxing and chilling, especially when I am cycling or riding my bike on the road.

samples.question: As I just said, I usually listen to music while I am doing things, yeah?
samples.transcript: Like, cycling and riding bikes because I grow boredom really fast. And I need to have something placed around my head to help me to stay concentrated while doing those things.

samples.question: Have you ever learned to play a musical instrument?
samples.transcript: Yeah, actually I had. Well, I tried learning piano but things turned ugly. So now I am a guitarist myself. I have been learning playing a guitar for five years plus. But still, I am a beginner because I do not really have too much time to practice it. Yeah.

samples.question: Do you prefer listening to music alone or with others?
samples.transcript: It really depends on the situation I am in. When I am cycling, I just prefer listening to music alone so that I can chill with the song, maybe a little bit of singing and to, like, practice my voice. But I still really love listening to music and enjoy it with my friends, especially when I am having some kind of pop or hip-hop music. It feels really great. It actually was yesterday, me and my group of friends, we heard the new album of Phung Khanh Linh and we actually enjoyed it. We sung all of it from the bottom of A Lung and it was crazy and also enjoyable. Alright, so.

samples.question: The first question is, is it important to have a break during work or study?
samples.transcript: Well, from my perspective, I think having breaks is compulsory because we are, we are human. We are not machines and even machines need to have times break time and, it needs to be taken care of. So when people work or study for a long time, for example, like five to six hours, they do need a break, like at least an hour break. Maybe go for lunch, take a walk, or just play some music so they can, relax down. And I think if they do not take breaks during those work, they will be burnt out and exhausted. So it will greatly affect their productivity and maybe have some negative outcome.
samples.transcript_original: Well, from my perspective, I think having breaks is compulsory because we are, uh, we are human. We are not machines and even machines need to have times break time and, uh, uh, it needs to be taken care of. So when people work or study for a long time, for example, like five to six hours, they do need a break, like at least an hour break. Maybe go for lunch, take a walk, or just play some music so they can, uh, relax down. And I think if they don't take breaks during those work, they will be burnt out and exhausted. So it will greatly affect their productivity and maybe have some negative outcome.

samples.question: So what sports do young people like to do now?
samples.transcript: Actually most of the popular sport are volleyball, basketball, and I think pickleball, which is just, been well known for months. But, the problem is kids nowadays, they do not usually do sport that much no more. Yeah. They used to do it a lot because the technology was not developed back then. So as the time change more technological devices went in Kids nowadays usually play iPads and online videos like Roblox Minecraft and etc So I think we do really need to make a change and push themselves to do more outdoor activities Not only to increase their physical health, but to let them know what the real world is, not the, not just inside the screen. -.

samples.question: Are there more activities for young people now than 20 years ago?
samples.transcript: Okay, so there are actually more, but things are different. So I think back in the past, when I was not even born yet, So, people used to have a lot of, physical and outdoor activities like, running, cycling, and maybe just playing with their neighbors. Nowadays, since, the modernization, we have a lot of technological device and it really helps. But it is a double-edged sword, sorry. So, it can help us to have more entertainment and convenience, but also it really, like, stop us from being energetic and active.
samples.transcript_original: Okay, so there are actually more, but things are different. samples.question: Alright, so can most people balance work and life in Vietnam?
samples.transcript: Okay, let me think. Well, I think for the older generation, no. But, it is totally different for the younger generation, which is the Gen Z.
samples.transcript_original: Okay, let me think. Well, I think for the older generation, no. But, uh, it's totally different for the younger generation, which is the Gen Z.

samples.question: Because I have seen a lot of youngsters, or like the new, brand new adults, they are called, okay?
samples.transcript: They are really good at balancing work. My cousin, for example, she has a 9 to 5 work. And she needs to do it very seriously. But still, she has a lot of time for her family. I remember one time we had a family gathering. Yeah. She was totally busy and she could not even, she did not even have any time for herself. But, with her creativity, her energetic personality, she managed to figure it out how to balance between work and life. So now she is really comfortable with living her life and she is enjoying it.
